framework_intro.para:
Here is a framework to help you present data effectively using a bar chart. This framework first gives a commentary based on the findings in the bar chart, followed by the bar chart itself with an informative caption.
There are spaces for you to add your own text and bar chart.

step.label: How can data be presented effectively?

commentary.para: One of the main ways you can present your data effectively is to use visuals. Visuals summarize your data and make it easy for readers to understand what has been found in your research.
This framework shows you how to use bar charts effectively.

step.label: Why has the writer used bar charts?

commentary.para: The following extract is from the ‘European Journal of Public Health’. It reports on a study of how Swedish children travel to school. The results are reported using a bar chart. Bar charts are useful for showing differences between discrete groups or categories.
Here is the framework that was used to present these data.

step.label: Look at the caption for the bar chart

commentary.para: The purpose of the caption is to explain clearly what the bar chart shows.

Words and phrases that highlight trends

checklist.point: You must know and understand your data well and then use visuals carefully to ensure that they efficiently display your data in a meaningful way.
There are many different visuals you can choose from to present your data. Common forms of visual are tables, bar charts, line graphs and pie charts.
All visuals need to be accompanied by two elements. These are: </br>1. Statements that summarize what your visual is about. </br>2. A commentary that interprets your findings for the reader.
Organize your data and comments into the framework.
Have I used a caption for my bar chart?
Have I summarized what the bar chart is about?
Have I interpreted the findings for the reader?
Have I used numbers or ordering to list findings?
Have I used words and phrases to highlight trends?
Have I used the passive to report the findings?
Have I quoted and referenced my sources accurately?
Have I checked vocabulary, grammar, spelling and punctuation?

paragraph.name: Presenting Data: bar charts
paragraph.desc: Using bar charts to present data

paragraph.name: Commentary on the bar chart
paragraph.desc: The commentary interprets the findings for the reader by summarizing the overall finding and pointing out a trend.
paragraph.tip: TIP The commentary on your findings will include some discussion of the significance of your findings. This should not be confused with your discussion section. The commentary on the findings only interprets the data for your reader. In your discussion section, you will widen the discussion by linking it to literature on the topic and discussing the implications of your findings.

content.para: Active commuting was reported by 62.9% of the whole national sample (37.8% walking and 25.6% cycling at least one way). However, it decreased with age (figure 1): 76.4% of fifth graders (~11 years old), 61.9% of seventh graders (~13 years old) and 50.0% of ninth graders (~15 years old). Public transport on the other hand increased with age: 18.8% of fifth graders, 36.3% of seventh graders and 42.6% of ninth graders. Only around 10% in any age group got to school by car or moped, though significantly fewer in the seventh grade, compared with both grades five and nine.
